thread.title: H.S. roundup: Killingly girls soccer edges Putnam
thread.title_full: H.S. roundup: Killingly girls soccer edges Putnam

author: The Bulletin
title: H.S. roundup: Killingly girls soccer edges Putnam
text: PUTNAM — Payton Fitzgerald scored twice in the first half to lead the Killingly girls soccer team to a 2-1 victory over Putnam in a non-conference game on Wednesday evening. Audrey Grayson and Allison Bonneau picked up assists for the Redgals (7-3). Saige Morin scored for the Clippers (4-4), assisted by Kira Clinkscale. Williams 4 Prov. Country Day 2 PROVIDENCE — Abby Xenelis scored two goals in the first 20 minutes to help the Blues earn the victory. Lucy Burr had a goal and two assists and Camryn Webinski also scored for Williams (3-2-1). Marianapolis 4 Lincoln 2 PROVIDENCE — Emily Sheridan scored two goals and the Golden Knights cruised to victory. Caroline Soucy put Marianapolis (6-1-1) on the board just three minutes into the game. Anna Bagley also scored. BOYS SOCCER Forman 8 Williams 2 NEW LONDON — J.J. Johnson and Callum Tresnan scored but the Blues could not keep up with the Lions. Ashton Kozlowski added an assist and Noah Bavolack made 15 saves for Williams (1-4-2). FIELD HOCKEY Pomfret 1 Kingswood-Oxford 0 WEST HARTFORD — Olivia Kremer’s goal provided enough offense to lift the Griffins over the Wyverns for their third win in a row. Remy Wells made two saves for Pomfret (3-3). BOYS XC Blues earn narrow win NEW HAVEN — Williams runner Will Jarrett (19:24) placed first and sixth-man Colin Ladd (23:38) narrowly edged Hamden Hall’s sixth man to break a 28-all tie and give the Blues the win. Colin Madaus (20:45) finished second for Williams, which also beat Westover School in the tri-meet. GIRLS XC Warrior finishes 1st NORWICH — Norwich Tech runner Ashley Roch (29:20) led the pack in an unscored meet with Putnam. 2 Blues in top 6 NEW HAVEN — Mary Madaus (24:01) placed fourth to lead the Williams runners, but the team did not place in a tri-meet against Hamden Hall and Westover School. Hattie Grant (25:06) finished in sixth for Williams. By The Bulletin
